title: Rogers Threatens Subpoena for USSPACECOM Documents
summary: The chairman of the House Armed Services Committee is threatening to subpoena DOD officials unless they provide documents relating to the decision to locate U.S. Space Command in Colorado instead […]

title: SpaceX kicks off August launch cadence with successful Falcon 9 launch
summary: Falcon 9 B1077 completed its 6th launch and landing, sending the Intelsat Galaxy-37/Horizons-4 satellites to geostationary transfer orbit. Launching midway through the...

title: Starship Booster 9 and launch infrastructure moving into critical testing phase
summary: After last week’s testing of Booster 9, the water deluge system, and other important activity at Starbase, the Starship program is now moving into a critical testing phase where Booster 9 will begin static test firings of the Raptor engines with the water deluge in use.

title: NASA awards Axiom Space 4th Crewed flight to ISS
summary: SpaceX will launch the 4th Axiom mission to the International Space Station no earlier than August 2024. NASA had previously signed a...

title: O3b mPower faces delays as SES investigates electrical issue
summary: SES needs to conduct extra tests before launching its next pair of O3b mPower satellites, the operator said Aug. 3, to investigate a glitch that is sporadically tripping off power modules on its first four in medium Earth orbit.
